titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Kni͡az' Nikolaĭ Vladimirovich Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Lyalya Kharitonova

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-02-22T13:07-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Writings, correspondence, notes, genealogical charts, certificates, and photographs relating to the history of the Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ family from the tenth to the twentieth century and to Russian émigré affairs. Consists mainly of drafts of, and working materials for, a genealogical history. Includes photographs of Emperor Nicholas II and Empress Alexandra.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Kni͡az' Nikolaĭ Vladimirovich Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1971.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Nikolaĭ Vladimirovich Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ was a Russian aristocrat, émigré to Yugoslavia and Switzerland, and interpreter for the Yugoslav delegation to the League of Nations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Nikolaĭ Vladimirovich Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ papers consist primarily of writings, correspondence, notes, genealogical charts, certificates, and photographs relating to the history of the Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ family from the tenth to the twentieth century and to Russian émigré affairs. The collection includes drafts of, and working materials for, a genealogical history. Includes photographs of Emperor Nicholas II and Empress Alexandra. Of particular interest in the collection are letters written to and from Romanov family members.

controlaccess.persname: Alexandra, consort of Nicholas II, Emperor of Russia, 1872-1918--Pictorial works.
Nicholas II, Emperor of Russia, 1868-1918--Pictorial works.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Certificates, curriculum vitae, identification cards, immigration and travel papers, and other materials relating to the life and career of Nikolaĭ Vladimirovich Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ, arranged alphabetically by physical form.
See also: Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ Family File.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes notarized copy of Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ's baptism certificate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes certificates, recommendations, and employment verification letters relating to Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ's diplomatic assignments, arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes an extract from diploma of the University of Belgrade.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Banque Cantonale Vaudoise statements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes passport, embarkation orders, various alien registration documents, and residency permits. See also: immigration papers and travel papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, clippings, notes, and genealogy charts. The original order of the files was retained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and receipts related to Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ's trip to his family homestead in Mir, Poland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes identification cards, immigration papers, correspondence, and other materials relating to the lives and careers of the Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ family members, arranged alphabetically by name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Andrei's birth, baptism, identity, and death certificates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes education certificates and employment verification letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes immigration papers and correspondence.

did.unittitle: Russian Orthodox Church Abroad award certificate, Belgrade,
Anastasia Nikolaevna (Anastasia of Montenegro), Grand Duchess of Russia,
Elena Vladimirovna, Grand Duchess of Russia,
Ksenia (Xenia) Aleksandrovna, Grand Duchess of Russia,
Militza Nikolaevna (Militza of Montenegro), Grand Duchess of Russia,
Nikolai (Nicholas) Nikolaevich Romanov, Grand Duke of Russia,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes drafts, notes, and envelopes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists primarily of memoirs of Princess Maria Aleksandrovna Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ (Mirskaia), recounting family history. Includes correspondence, notes, and clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Monthly student progress reports, Grangeneuve Institut agricole de l'Etat de Fribourg.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes references.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes "Iverskaia Bogomater'" by V. Maevskii, 1932, inscribed by Maria Aleksandrovna for her son Nikolaĭ Vladimirovich.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Statement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name or subject.

did.unittitle: Nicholas II at Borodino Station on the occasion of the 100th anniversary of the Battle of Borodino,
Russian Orthodox Church Abroad in Belgrade,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs depicting Nikolaĭ Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ, his family, and friends, arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: "L'ange de la mort" and other poems,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes drafts, notes, and clippings.

did.unittitle: "Les princes Sviatopolk-Mirsky, issus de Rurik," NdR La Noblesse de Russie, deuxième edition, publiés par Nicolas Ikonnikov, Paris,
"Les princes Sviatopolk-Mirsky (La généalogique des princes Sviatopolk-Mirsky),"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes research material, draft chapters, correspondence, and illustrations. The files are retained as they were originally compiled and entitled by creator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes notes, drafts, correspondence, clippings, and collected photocopies of articles and texts relating to Russian history.

Ch. III.5 "Les alliances dynastiques des grands princes rurikides"
Ch. IV "La généalogique des princes Sviatopolk-Mirsky (Russie impériale)"

Ch. IX "La famille des princes Sviatopolk"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs, postcards, charts, drawings, and clippings.

did.unittitle: "Biographical Dictionary of the Corps of Faces: An Outline of the Project," by Marvin Lyons,
Encounter: Literature Arts Current Affairs, No. 22, London,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes "Comrade Prince: A Memoir of D.S. Mirsky," by Edmund Wilson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of family papers sent from Sofia Strandmann to Nikolaĭ Vladimirovich Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ. Includes Strandmann family genealogy, correspondence, photographs, clippings, and notes, arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Princess Maria Aleksandrovna Svi͡atopolk-Mirskiĭ (Mirskaia)'s documents in the possession of the Lavriki estate in the region of Kiev, in Ukraine. Includes maps and drawings.
